slideInfo.mainText: 1933: Hitler becomes chancellor of Germany under President Hindenburg 1934: Hitler consolidates power and all other political parties are outlawed 1935: Hitler repudiates all aspects of the Versailles treaty pertaining to Germany; the Nuremberg Laws discriminate severely against Jews 1938: Germany annexes Austria; Jewish businesses, property, and synagogues are destroyed in <font face='lc-Italic'>Kristallnacht </font>while thousands of Jews are arrested or beaten May, 1939: Germany seizes Czechoslovakia September, 1939: Germany invades Poland beginning World War II 1939-1945: World War II results in the death of over 50 million people; the Holocaust results in the death of nearly 6 million Jews
